website_summaries.verdict: Although the components stand out among similar tool playsets for looking a lot like the real deal, some of the pieces come with durability concerns.
pros: Little builders will feel all grown up when playing with the realistic-looking tools in this playset that sports the Black + Decker name
cons: Some of tools are sturdier than others – the screwdrivers and toy belt in particular feel somewhat flimsy
For kids over 3 – has small parts

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was a little batter quality.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a Halloween costume so I wasn’t expecting much but it’s a bit cheaper made than I thought. I figured the tool bough would be made with a ticker material since they usually are, but it’s just a really thin flimsy piece of felt. So I’m a bit disappointed. I was hoping for it to have more use than just a halloween costume but oh well. It only is only a piece of Velcro to hold the belt on so you can only put a very small about of weight. Thankfully my 2 year old is small enough I can tie it in a knot at the moment.
customer_reviews.author: Lstard

customer_reviews.title: Great Toy with Lots of Use
customer_reviews.text: My son was showing an interest in tools so we got him this set and it instantly became his favorite toy. The hammer and screwdriver he carried around for months "fixing things" around the house. We ended up later getting him a work bench to go with it and these pieces are still some of his favorites. It improved his verbal skills as we talked about what the different tools were and what they did. The hand-eye coordination, motor skills, were also utilized and improved with the included screws.
customer_reviews.author: Lumynara

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for little tool lovers
customer_reviews.text: My son LOVES all things tool and construction, so this was a great addition to his expanding tool collection. The belt is adjustable with a velcro strap. The goggles are a little tight for my sons head, but he still likes wearing them. The only complaint I have is with the hammer. The black head comes off and is now wiggly, it doesn't fly off without being pulled though. Overall, happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: B Rose

customer_reviews.title: Belt is mediocre quality, but my son loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this specifically for the tool belt because the one I wanted wouldn't arrive before Halloween. Pros: Love the tools. Fits with the second hand tool bench we already own. My son love it. Cons: Screwdrivers aren't attached to handles (The handle and the "metal" part come apart. Will try to glue together. I've been told this is how they are suppose to be, but it's annoying to loose one of the pieces). Elastic on goggles is too tight and will need to replace. The pockets aren't deep enough to hold the tools, tools fall out. Belt is a junk piece of fabric and velcro so it also falls off.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: Great Great for your son, nephew, grandson and even your daughter
customer_reviews.text: This tool set was perfect for my son, he was able to wear the belt which was a tad bit too long, and use the googles. He was able to use the nails and screws in the set and it really helped with his fine motor skills. After showing him what to do the first time, he took it from there. The tool kit is super durable and all the pieces were there. The interesting thing was my daughter who loves to help and fix things, started to use the tool kit as well. So this is not gender exclusive.
customer_reviews.author: Avrey Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Add ONE STITCH, please.
customer_reviews.text: Top picture is ONE TACK STITCH to keep the belt on the bag by Mom. Bottom picture is product as delivered. One star for a very simple manufacturing fix that would prevented my child from having a WHIP on Christmas morning and having to thread the belt through the bag 10 times to play with and wear tool belt. Black & Decker is a good name...I was surprised. I should not have to sew or modify a nearly $20 toy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Only the tools are worth it
customer_reviews.text: The belt is extremely low quality. The tools fall easily and the rope used to tied around the waist comes out of the tool pouch and was very loose on my son when it was first used, before coming apart. I give it a 3 stars though because of the tools that come with it. My son also has the black & decker jr. Tool bench and it gives more for him to play with and replacements in case he loses any.
customer_reviews.author: mommy

customer_reviews.title: I really like the variety of tools that come with this and ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this for my 2.5yr old who loves to play with his Papa's tools. I really like the variety of tools that come with this and the belt and glasses are so cute, although my son refuses to wear them, he'll come around though :) I am just a little disappointed in the nails, screw, and wood portion... my son can't play with this on his own because i have to hold the "wood" for him so he can screw/hammer the screws and nails in. It's just a weird design I guess..
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Nephew's favorite toy!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old nephew loved this kit for his birthday! As soon as he opened it, he screamed "A TOOLBELT!!" He literally abandoned all other unopened presents to take this out and put it on. He was so cute walking around "working" with his little safety glasses on. He couldn't be bothered with pictures or distractions while he was playing (see the picture below). It's been almost a year since his birthday and this has still held up. I recommend for your little worker!
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Not Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Less than impressed. The waist is too loose on my three-year-old so he cant use it unless he is wearing jeans with belt loops.Also the pouch easily slides off the strap so one of the pieces always end up lost. The tools are decent - especially the goggles seem to be made very well in my kit. The screwdrivers seem to come apart into two pieces fairly easily as well.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: My kid wants to fix everything
customer_reviews.text: Cool little tool set. My son likes to help me fix things around the house. Makes him feel like a man.
customer_reviews.author: Dj DIYM

customer_reviews.title: 21 month olds favorite toy
customer_reviews.text: I have a 21 month old who loves this set. He asks me every day when he first wakes up to put his tool belt on. He keeps all of his tools lined up on the hearth and even said "glasses" for the first time asking me to put those on him. He stays busy using his hammer to fix various objects. The quality is great. Truly a wonderful purchase for our toddler!
customer_reviews.author: mandak1014

customer_reviews.title: Acceptable
customer_reviews.text: This product is ok for the little kids, but pretty cheaply constructed for the older kids. I purchased this for my son to use with his Halloween costume and the "belt" (piece of fabric with velcro) was not long enough to go around his waist. We ended up just putting it on his regular belt. The tool bag is basically just a piece of felt. And the tools fall out of it because it is not strong enough to carry them or big enough.
customer_reviews.author: Runwee

customer_reviews.title: This is a fun toy for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a fun toy for the price. The tool belt is kind of cheap but for $10 it's about what I would expect. My son is 20 months old and he has a good time with it but it doesn't entertain him for long periods of time, the pieces that the screws and nails go into aren't that easy for him to use but maybe he's a little young for that part.The tools have held up well to heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: MEC

customer_reviews.title: Great quality plastic tools for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Good quality plastic tools. I purchased these as our son loves to help daddy and investigates daddy's toys. This way he has His own. The belt is still a bit big as he is only 17 months old. So he can't wear it without it hitting his knees when loaded with his tools. The tools itself are made with good quality sturdy plastic. No sharp edges to worry about so the finish was completed with small kids in mind.
customer_reviews.author: NicoTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this tool belt and kit. I bought it used but everything was included. The tool belt is too big (which I will fix with extra Velcro) and the giggles were too tight. Other than that, it’s a good quality and will be hours of fun for my kid.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my daughter and she loves it
customer_reviews.text: Probably meant more for a boy but our daughter wanted he own tools and tool belt to help daddy build stuff. She love it and plays with it every day. It has parts that you can “screw” together. And the tool belt hold everything it comes with.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey wood

customer_reviews.title: misleading
customer_reviews.text: the toy is ok but the packaging is misleading. there is a picture of a boy holding a power drill, but the set does not contain a power drill. my wife bought it online and we didnt notice there was no drill until it arrived. very disapointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My son loved it, but I was expecting it to be ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loved it, but I was expecting it to be a little better made. The tools themselves are built fine, it was the actual belt that is sort of bad. It doesn't stay on and it is too small of a pocket, so the tools fall out. I bought this as part of a costume for Halloween for my son and I actually had to tape all the toys in so they wouldn't fall out every two seconds. All of that aside, he loves the tools (as all little boys do) and I was able to use his Halloween costume as toys he could play with later. So I am still happy that I bought it!
customer_reviews.author: Traci

customer_reviews.title: Toolbelt design lacking
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Tools well made. Screwdrivers work well with screws in the set. Cons: "toolbelt" constructed like it was an afterthought. Velcro doesnt work to suit various size wastes. Holding area for tools doesnt really contain the tools efficiently to be worn and played with.
customer_reviews.author: Silverliner_98

customer_reviews.title: so I don't recommend this for an older child
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my son's Halloween costume and appreciate the fact that he can play with it after the fact. The utility belt is small, so I don't recommend this for an older child, but my son is 18 months and it fits him perfectly. The tools seem pretty well made. The goggles are too big for him. They actually fit me, so these could be made a little smaller to fit a child. I would purchase more Black and Decker play tools!
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy and for Looks Only.
customer_reviews.text: Got this as add on to the kids tool bench which is very nice. This is not. Tools are flimsy. Only for show and not for even pretend use. Tool belt is a joke. Not big enough to put a dog bone into. Junk mostly. Don’t buy this
customer_reviews.author: Ibfnp

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: My 2 yr old daughter loves this set! We took her to a children's museum and she was obsessed with the play tools they had. These are even better quality than the ones at the museum. Great set for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: C.R.L.

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars from my 2-year old; 3 stars from me.  A good play set with the potential to be great!
customer_reviews.text: 5 stars from my 2-year old, but 3 stars from me. This play set is good, but could've been great!. The tools are well made plastic and fit the included screws/bolts and nails well. The little pieces of "wood" are too thin and you cannot easily put the screws and nails side by side in the holes provided. The tool belt is extremely basic and could use some more Velcro to accommodate the waist size of smaller children/toddlers. My kid loves it and uses the tools to "fix" everything he can. For pure enjoyment from him, the price can't be beat. I'll most likely purchase more of the Black & Decker's Junior Toy Tools as he grows.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: This is a great toy toolset for your child who wants to play ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a great toy toolset for your child who wants to play workshop. My son and daughter love to pretend with this set and there are enough tools for them both to be able to play. Quality construction and not too heavy. We don's have to worry that the kids will do too much serious damage to themselves or our household things.
customer_reviews.author: Jared S.

customer_reviews.title: The tools are all still in great shape and the tool belt is the perfect size ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this for a Halloween costume and worked perfectly. The tools are all still in great shape and the tool belt is the perfect size for play. The belt strap was a little long for my boys but it was easy to adjust by tying in a loop before velcroing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice selection
customer_reviews.text: Very cute package of things little boys love. It was to young for the little guy I was buying for. Very nice for younger children
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Shuster

customer_reviews.title: I bought the tool set for our grandson's 3rd birthday ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought the tool set for our grandson's 3rd birthday. He loves to "fix" things both inside and outside the house. He absolutely loves it!. His mama reports he has been repairing in sight for weeks. Thanks for fueling a little one's imagination!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: It's definitely fun and cool, but the belt itself is somewhat not up to par. one of the loops that you would put the hammer into is not big enough for it, so you pop the screwdriver in that loop instead, for it to be too top heavy and then it falls on the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie J. Main

customer_reviews.title: Time to bring back imagination!
customer_reviews.text: Fun toy for kids to use their imagination with. So many toys take the fun of imagination away. I got this toy so that electronics and TV can be shut off and imagination put to use. My fiance's son loves it and plays with it often. He asks me for things to "fix" and goes around the house doing so! Such a great helper!
customer_reviews.author: Crayon

customer_reviews.title: Great tool belt.
customer_reviews.text: Nephew loves this tool belt. All the tools are well made and fit the belt well. Extra pieces the screw and pound together are perfect. He loved being able to work with all of it.
customer_reviews.author: Katherine

customer_reviews.title: Great starter set into the world of tools
customer_reviews.text: My nephew wouldn't stop using this stuff! Great starter set into the world of tools! Granted...you get what you pay for. This is a inexpensive toy, so don't expect Craftsman quality. It's pretty cheap...but for a little one, they don't care and makes for hours of entertainment.
customer_reviews.author: Azengar

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: For my grandson's birthday, and it is absolutely adorable. I bought one for another grandson's Christmas and it's been a big hit.
customer_reviews.author: Quijen

customer_reviews.title: Fun great gift
customer_reviews.text: What can I say it’s plastic so it’s breakable but it’s cool stuff nephew loves it
customer_reviews.author: JAYG

customer_reviews.title: Decent tool belt
customer_reviews.text: The tools and stuff are fun, however I wish the belt was more adjustable as it hangs off my son. Also when tools are in the loops, they sometimes fall out. However, it goes good with his tool bench and he enjoys it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarahh

customer_reviews.title: Great little kit for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great little kit for the price. It is all a little cheaply made, but my wild kids haven't broken it yet. The tool pouch is good, but the belt doesn't get small enough for skinny kids and it is just held on by Velcro rather than a buckle.
customer_reviews.author: James Mossman

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Our two year old grandson loves this - I did have to add another piece of Velcro to make it fit his little waist... It's a fun toy and he wears it whenever he wants to work with his Papaw!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Foster

customer_reviews.title: Safe and interesting toy for boys
customer_reviews.text: I liked that my grandson put the goggles on and concentrated on trying to use all the tools. He did try to put the screwdriver up his nose, but it didn't fit, so it was sort of funny and not dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Stark

customer_reviews.title: he love this set
customer_reviews.text: 3 year old grandson now fixes the tv, the door hinges, thecar and anything he can find. needless to say, he love this set. nice quality !
customer_reviews.author: gramnancee

customer_reviews.title: Great toddler tool set
customer_reviews.text: Grandson can't wait to help dad fix things, well worth it
customer_reviews.author: J. D. Orach

customer_reviews.title: Wasted money
customer_reviews.text: The tool apron barely fit our 14 month old grandson. This was a gift for our 3 1/2 year old granddaughter. The screws and nails have nothing to hold them on to nail. The children enjoy the plastic goggles, but they do not play with this.
customer_reviews.author: Retired teacher

customer_reviews.title: Cheap version
customer_reviews.text: The tools are very lightweight and cheap compared to the Home Depot set that we have. The tool belt is secured with velcro and is about 6 inches too big to fit on my 2 year old's waist. I would go with a Home Depot set for the extra $5-10, it's worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ksminaro

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Great toy for a great price. Will make a great gift!
customer_reviews.author: aaron cross

customer_reviews.title: Grandson loved it
customer_reviews.text: He had the tool belt on with all the tools and the googles by the time we barely got out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: A wonderful Christmas gift that seems to be made of sturdy, good quality :)
customer_reviews.author: Shayna

customer_reviews.title: meh.
customer_reviews.text: the little pouch just doesn't hold the stuff really. The tools are ok. The nails and screws thing would be better if the thing with the holes actually had a stand vs having to hold it yourself...
customer_reviews.author: Canuck72

customer_reviews.title: So cute
customer_reviews.text: Such a cute little toy belt we got for my son and nephew. They love them
customer_reviews.author: Jessica munoz

customer_reviews.title: it seems like when they re-did the logo
customer_reviews.text: So, I ordered this tool set to go with the Black & Decker tool bench I got for my son a few years back. Well, it seems like when they re-did the logo, they took the cheap route with a lot of their toy tools too. The plastic is very flimsy and the screws are hollow vs. the others that came with the set. Overall it's a cute set, and will get use out of it, but the tools are lesser quality than they used to be.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Collins

customer_reviews.title: Super cute
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my nephew who absolutely adored it. Package came as expected and in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. B

customer_reviews.title: Great gift!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my grandson (4 year old) and he put it on Christmas morning and didn’t take it off till bedtime!
customer_reviews.author: JTH

customer_reviews.title: Cute and realistic tools
customer_reviews.text: Cute gift for children but they aren't very sturdy or durable. The boys loved them though.
customer_reviews.author: SassyStacy68

customer_reviews.title: Perfect little tool belt for a junior helping his mommy or daddy.
customer_reviews.text: This little tool belt was so cute and cool. I would have liked it to have a little more pockets. I liked that the safety glasses actually had a plastic sense. The way the loop to hold the screw driver was created, does not hold the screw driver up right. However, overall we loved this little set.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a Christmas gift for my 4 year old grandson. As soon as he opened it, he had it on and started "fixing" things. He always wears it when playing with his Legos and other construction toys. He loves it, I'm happy.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew H.

customer_reviews.title: Great gift , nice belt quality toy tools
customer_reviews.text: A gift for a busy 2 year old that loves to work on cars or anything he can
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Other than that is is a fine toy.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson wears it everywhere but the tools don't stay in the pouch. It needs a flap on it. Other than that is is a fine toy.
customer_reviews.author: M. A. Amato

customer_reviews.title: Great gifts
customer_reviews.text: So many parts! My nephew loves it. Now he can build and fix stuff with his daddy.
customer_reviews.author: Jen Thompson

customer_reviews.title: Otherwise a good
customer_reviews.text: Needs more fake wood to work with. With nothing to screw or hammer screws or nails into, why bother. Otherwise a good toy
customer_reviews.author: easyshopping

customer_reviews.title: Got this and the drill and chainsaw for great grandsons 4th birthday
customer_reviews.text: Got this and the drill and chainsaw for great grandsons 4th birthday. Best toys ever. He will be "fixing" everything in the house.
customer_reviews.author: kookiedookie.... Grove City, OHIO

customer_reviews.title: Too big for 3 year old
customer_reviews.text: The belt is too big for my 3 year old daughter, so we had to modify it to stay up around her waist. The goggles were too tight and left imprints on her face, so we took the elastic out and replaced with longer piece of elastic. Otherwise, functions as a good tool belt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tools are not just for boys any more!
customer_reviews.text: The older granddaughter looks so cute in her tool belt; ready to help Daddy & Mommy with household maintenance!
customer_reviews.author: gail cooks

customer_reviews.title: NOT THAT GREAT. The picture looks great
customer_reviews.text: NOT THAT GREAT. The picture looks great. But very poor quality. Might as well loop a piece a fabrric around a rope and call it tool bags... the wrenches and screw drivers, hammer have kept my son's attention but the screws and board maybe washer really not even sure what it is is a waste... Wish I would have looked at the reviews lol
customer_reviews.author: Brittney Brock

customer_reviews.title: Cute kids tool belt
customer_reviews.text: Based on the cartoon image I thought the belt would have two pockets, but there is only one. This isn't a big deal, but there really isn't much space to put all the "tools" that came with it. My son lives it though, it was perfect for his Bob the Builder Halloween costume.
customer_reviews.author: HappyMaMa

customer_reviews.title: Nice toddler set
customer_reviews.text: Great little tool set. Realistic in looks. Very nice toddler set.
customer_reviews.author: a customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice gift for a little boy!
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old loved this gift. Only problem was that is took 30 minutes to open it. Toddlers aren’t that patient. Once we got it open, he tried to fix everything in the house!
customer_reviews.author: Tifani Lively

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: So cute! My 3 year old son loves this! It is pretty basic, but a sweet little toy that he can play with!
customer_reviews.author: rick s

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loved this because he looked just like his grandpa with almost look alike tools
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: My lil carpenter!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect gift for a 3-4 yr. Old. My grandson loves this. Follows dad around and stops to do repairs on his bike, stairs etc.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy for kids to put on themself
customer_reviews.text: Fun for my kiddo, we bought this with the black and decker work bench. My son loves it
customer_reviews.author: Chey

customer_reviews.title: Does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Nice toolbelt. Tools are great and son was excited. The velcro we have on the tightest and it still hangs low on my 3 year old. Made for bigger kids I guess. Also, the material of the pocket on the took belt is thinner than expected for the money and from the look. Still nice and he enjoys it so far.
customer_reviews.author: ECARMA

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: my 3 yo old son loves these tools! he plays a lot with them
customer_reviews.author: Natalka

customer_reviews.title: great for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: I was a bad mom and got rid of my toddler's fisher price work bench this year and replaced it with a much smaller toy: this tool set. He's used this more than he ever did the other one for the last 3 years.
customer_reviews.author: horsewish

customer_reviews.title: Great set, my kids love it
customer_reviews.text: Great set, my kids love it! We actually bought this set and another and this one is much higher quality. The tools are a perfect size for my 4 year old.
customer_reviews.author: Erica Montoya

customer_reviews.title: Very flimsy. Great tools though.
customer_reviews.text: Great idea, but the belt could be better, sturdier. Gret tools, but they tend to fall off the pockets, except for the ones that go on the loops.
customer_reviews.author: Tory

customer_reviews.title: The Truth
customer_reviews.text: Really cute and fun. I bought for my 2 year old, it a little big for him but he’ll grow into and he loves playing with the tools.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tool Belt - tools great/belt not so much
customer_reviews.text: The idea of this kit is great but the belt was deceiving and it should have been left off or created with better quality
customer_reviews.author: Hercules

customer_reviews.title: Needs a container for tools...or for tools to fit into (firmly) the tool belt.
customer_reviews.text: Tools don’t fit in or stay in the belt, goggles are so tight that they hurt child’s face. Overall, I wouldn’t recommend this toy set.
customer_reviews.author: P K.

customer_reviews.title: The tool belt tie ripped first day or this would ...
customer_reviews.text: The tool belt tie ripped first day or this would get a 5. My 3 yr old grandson won't take the goggles off. He loves all of the tools.
customer_reviews.author: Marlene Hunter

customer_reviews.title: Bought this for my nephew for his birthday. Be ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my nephew for his birthday. Be prepared to get the jaws of life out to get the plastic apart just to get to the tools. The tools themselves are ok, if a bit chintzy. That being said, he pounded on endstands, toes, etc. with the hammer, and it's still in one piece.
customer_reviews.author: JZimm

customer_reviews.title: Tool bet set
customer_reviews.text: My son loves this play set! He got it for his second birthday and it's gotten daily use since.
customer_reviews.author: Stef

customer_reviews.title: great toy tool set!
customer_reviews.text: This has been by far our boys favorite Christmas gift. They now follow daddy all over the house helping him "fix" things. The tools are sturdy, well made, and surprisingly realistic (with the exception of the power drill). Delivery was very fast and the price was well below Toys R Us, which was the only retailor we could find them at. We would definitely recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Lamb

customer_reviews.title: Good for the house
customer_reviews.text: Cool toolset but the belt it huge and doesn't really stay on well, the tools fall out very easily. Ok for around the house but not for in parks or going on walks.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. C. Curless

customer_reviews.title: Both my boys love these tools
customer_reviews.text: Both my boys love these tools! The plastic did fall out of the goggles, but they still love the goggles just the same.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Boyd

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: i don't think this is made as the same size as the other stuff.
customer_reviews.author: avory wilson

customer_reviews.title: Low price, low quality.
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality, especially the belt. The belt did not hold the tools at all.
customer_reviews.author: BostonNana

customer_reviews.title: Good product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a Christmas gift for my 3 y/o grandson. He loved it and wore his belt around all day. Yes I would recommend this for other up and coming builders!!
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Evans

customer_reviews.title: Tool belt makes two-year-old ready for any job.
customer_reviews.text: My grandson received this as a gift at Christmas. He wore his tool belt and tools and fix everything around the house. Quite a fast learner for a two-year-old.
customer_reviews.author: Sheree

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for "Daddy's little helper!"
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4-year-old grandson who likes to help his Dad around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Patti Bromley

customer_reviews.title: Tools
customer_reviews.text: Both my grandkids, boy age 5 and girl age 4, are seriously into building and tools. This set allows them to strap on their tool belts and go about the business of building. Both took to the outdoors to find pieces of wood and sticks and rocks and things to hammer and screw. Kept them busy for hours. Great toy.
customer_reviews.author: Edna Arbuckle

customer_reviews.title: My son loves his belt! It is all holding ...
customer_reviews.text: My son loves his belt! It is all holding up very well. He is 2 and is very hard on his toys.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Campbell

customer_reviews.title: (Oops) But at least I know I will have a happy boy Christmas morning
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my three year old for Christmas. Unfortunately he saw it before it was wrapped so I had to lie and say it was for his cousin. He was devastated to hear that. (Oops) But at least I know I will have a happy boy Christmas morning.
customer_reviews.author: Amy L. Gattone

customer_reviews.title: I love that this looks real and isn't a bunch of ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift and can't wait to give it to my godson. I love that this looks real and isn't a bunch of blue and green tools. I saw this in a few stores but didn't decide to buy it until later. Disappointed that the price here is a few dollars more than in stores, but I went for it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: sacmcdonald

customer_reviews.title: What FUN!!
customer_reviews.text: My grandson was so thrilled with his gift and plays with it daily! Package was received in great condition and very timely manner.
customer_reviews.author: ohmomma54

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Our 18 month old grandson loves playing with these toy tools... keeps him busy for hours at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Bogleha52

customer_reviews.title: Good tools, great price
customer_reviews.text: Very good colors and good tools. My son 1.5 years old was delighted and wants to fix everything. When he sees that I'm fixing something, it comes with his tools to help me. Very good price, I recommend it. Muy buenos colores y buenas herramientas. Le encantaron a mi hijo de 1 1/2 años para q se enseñe a reparar cosas. Siempre q me mira reparando algo, viene con sus herramientas a ayudarme. Muy buen precio, las recomiendo.
customer_reviews.author: Manuel Islas

customer_reviews.title: My two year old nephew totally loved this kit
customer_reviews.text: My two year old nephew totally loved this kit! He went through a phase of wanting to carry a real screwdriver EVERYWHERE so this was a much safer alternative :)
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Audette

customer_reviews.title: He loved it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 3 year old grandson to surprise him when he went on a Daddy, Son and Grandad trip to work on the lake house. He loved it!
customer_reviews.author: dlg

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the little helper!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our two-year-old grandson for Christmas. He wanted it put on right away and walked around wearing the goggles. Perfect for the little one who wants to "work" with dad or grandpa!
customer_reviews.author: LAM

customer_reviews.title: Decent product, but cheap made.
customer_reviews.text: The only reason it isn’t rated higher for me is it’s cheap made. It feels flemsy in the hand.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Godeaux

customer_reviews.title: Toys
customer_reviews.text: This was a gift and the child loves it and uses it a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen  F

customer_reviews.title: Great for your little Mr. Fix It!
customer_reviews.text: I expected my son to just play with the hammer, but he loved playing with every piece!
customer_reviews.author: Okaay

product_meta.title: Black & Decker Junior 14 Piece Toy Tool Belt Set
product_meta.description:
Make sure your little helper is ready for any job with the Black and Decker Junior Tool Belt Set. This 14-piece set comes with realistic-looking kids' tools, including a hammer, screwdriver, wrench, nails and other accessories round out the set. Tuck it all away in the included kids' tool belt, complete with the Black and Decker logo. For ages 3 and up.

BRAND STORY
By Black & Decker Junior
feature_bullets: Tool belt is complete with the Black and Decker logo
This 14 piece set comes with realistic looking tools
